text.0: the priest goes forth to sacrifice with wondrous power sending aloft the hymn of glorious brilliancy.
text.1: he moves to meet the ladles turning to the right which are the first to kiss the place where he abides.
text.2: to him sang forth the flowing streams of holy law encompassed in the home and birthplace of the god.
text.3: he when he dwelt extended in the waters lap absorbed those godlike powers for which he is adored.
text.4: seeking in course altern to reach the selfsame end the two copartners strive to win this beauteous form.
text.5: like bhaga must he be duly invoked by us as he who drives the car holds fast the horses reins.
text.6: he whom the two copartners with observance tend the pair who dwell together in the same abode.
text.7: by night as in the day the grey one was born young passing untouched by eld through many an age of man.
text.8: him the ten fingers the devotions animate we mortals call on him a god to give us help.
text.9: he speeds over the sloping surface of the land new deeds hath he performed with those who gird him round.
text.10: for agni like a herdsman thou by thine own might rulest oer all that is in heaven and on the earth.
text.11: and these two mighty ones bright golden closely joined rolling them round are come unto thy sacred grass.
text.12: agni accept with joy be glad in this our prayer joygiver selfsustained strong born of holy law.
text.13: for fair to see art thou turning to every side pleasant to look on as a dwelling filled with food.
